news_header: Millions in England and Wales may struggle with rising water bills, with a proposed average increase of £19 annually from 2025 to 2030, as many households already face financial strain.
news_text: A consumer watchdog warns that millions of households in England and Wales will face difficulties paying increased water bills, projected to rise by an average of £19 a year from 2025 to 2030. A survey revealed that 18% of households are already struggling with bills, and 40% anticipate difficulties with the upcoming increases. Water companies are proposing more support for vulnerable customers, while the Consumer Council for Water calls for a unified social tariff to ensure consistent assistance across regions. Ofwat is investigating water companies after a rise in sewage spills, and customers demand transparency in how their money is spent.
